Or, if you're interested in delving deeper into the origins of one of cinema's most iconic characters, "Hannibal Rising" (2007) offers a chilling prequel to the story of Hannibal Lecter. Enjoy the ride!

I'd highly recommend watching "Memento" starring Guy Pearce and Carrie-Anne Moss. This thought-provoking film is a psychological thriller where the protagonist, suffering from short-term memory loss, investigates his wife's murder. It offers a unique narrative structure that keeps you engaged till the end.

If you're in the mood for some drama and intrigue, "Smilla's Sense of Snow" featuring Julia Ormond might also appeal to you. This film tells the story of a half-Inuit woman who investigates the mysterious death of a young Inuit boy in Copenhagen, leading her on an adventure to Greenland.
